186012267.review:
[h1]Final Fantasy IX Review [/h1]

[h3]Der letzte Teil der PS1 Ära an Final Fantasy, auch der beste?
Mitnichten, aber dafür ein pures unvergessliches Final Fantasy![/h3]

[u]Spiele Setup:[/u]
Steam Deck Oled handheld mode 60fps 4 tdp (9 Std Spielzeit)
Steam Deck docked Mode 60fps 8tdp Dual Sense <-- Favorit
Moguri Mode, Bessere Hintergründe, PS1 Button, PS1 Soundtrack

[i]Auf der Steam Deck perfekt zu spielen! Kann ich nur weiterempfehlen, on the go und am Fernseher/Beamer![/i]

[h3]Gameplay 09/10:[/h3]

Wer Final Fantasy nicht kennt, hat leider eine Bildungslücke (unter JRPG Ethusiasten!), die unbedingt nachgeholt werden soll, am besten mit einem von der PS1 Ära bzw SNES Ära(IV od VI). Die ersten 9 Teile folgen fast den gleichen Kriterien.
--> Turn based Combat (ATB ab 4 glaube ich), --> Minispiele, --> Rätsel mehr oder weniger, 
progressives freispielen mehrerer Möglichkeiten (Chochobo/Welterkundung/ usw..)
FF IX macht es hier nicht anders, ich würde sogar soweit gehen das FFIX die besten Eigenschaften genommen hat und in einem Spiel zusammenfasst.
Mir hat hier der Chocobo Prozess unheimlich gut gefallen. Aber kommen wir einmal zum wesentlichen dem Kampfsystem.
Active Time Battle lautet das rundenbasierende Zauberwort für die Kämpfe. Angriffe/Zauber/Fähigkeiten bzw. Items können hier zum Einsatz gekommen. Um eiun besseres Verständnis zu dieser Thematik zu haben empfehle ich ganz plump, spielts es! :-)
Diesmal spielen wir bis zu 4 gleichzeitigen Protagonisten (Abweichung von VII & VIII, ich glaub der VI war auch mit Vier).
Jeder Character hat seine eigenen Fähigkeiten, die er mithilfe von Waffen ausbaut indem er diese lernt durch erhalten von APs.
Level wird mit Erfahrungen vorangetrieben, ist hier jedoch sekundär den die vielen Ausrüsten geben dementsprechend Attribute/Abilitys.
Gameplay ist ausbalanciert und man kommt leicht rein. Die Story treibt und das ist gut so, denn dadurch lernt man neue Gegeneden kennen. 
Am Schluss *spoiler* kann man die ganze Welt bereisen. 

[h3]Atmosphäre 09/10:[/h3]

Vorgerenderte Hintergründe waren zur PS1 Zeiten fantastisch den die limitierte HW der PS1 hatte ja bekanntlich nur 33 Mhz^^.
Die Polygonfiguren waren für ein spätes Playstation Spiel auf ein neues Niveau gebracht und sah tip  top aus!
Kann so ein Grafikgerüst in der heutigen zeit überhaupt bestehen? Ja das kann es! Mithilfe von Mods kann auch mit einer 16:9 Ausrichtung gespielt werden. hintergründe wurden mit KI verbesstert und aufgewertet. 
Die Auftwertung wirkt phänomenal und die Polygon Modelle wurden aufgefrischt, sodass das Spiel auch im jahre 2025 sehr gut gealtert ist.
Hübsch anzusehen sind auch die Filmsequenzen wobei hier man das alter bemerkt. nichtsdestotrotz ist die Atmosphäre / Präsentation top, für ein nahezu 25 Jahre altes Spiel!

[h3]Story 10/10:[/h3]

Die Geschichte in einem Final Fantasy Spiel ist das auf und ab, ist die Story schlecht ist das Spiel schlecht (Kann man eigentlich für jedes RPG behaupten^^)..
Final Fantasy IX hat eine tolle Geschichte, der Plot ist gut durchdacht aber zuteils konnte ich schon am Anfang vieles erahnen. 
Die einzelnen Protagonisten erzählen eine tolle eigene Geschichte sodass man sich in den einzelnen Individuen hineinversetzen kann.
Toll finde ich wie die Dialoge geführt werden, hier ist ein ganz besonderer Schmäh präsent. Aber die Präsentation der einzelnen Geschehnisse durch den Active Time Events sind grandios ummgesetzt worden.
Die Cinemastische PRäsentation der einzelnen Story Elemente fallen unter der Kategorie grandios.
Ist es die Beste Story in einem FF, subjektiv nein, objektiv... naja maybe. 
Wir reden hier von Final Fantasy Spielen und hier ist eine subjektive Wahrnehmung nicht auszuschließen.
Einziger Wehrmutstropfen ist, das für mich der Hauptprotagonist nicht gut gescriptet ist. Mehr gehe ich nicht ein und spoilern will ich auch nicht, aber für das für was dieser steht in seine Rolle ist er eindeutig zu flach.

[h3]Sound 10/10:[/h3]

Final Fantasy Games haben immer ein Soundtrack mit Eargasm effekt. Egal welcher Teil jeder einzelne Final Fantasy Titel könnte unter die Top 10 der besten Soundtracks kommen.
Je nach subjektiver Wahrnehmung kann man wählen, für mich jedoch ist dieser Teil leider hinter den anderen PS1 Ablegern. 
Das Level der Soundtracks in Final Fantasy ist gegenüber anderen Spielen im gleichen Genre weit oben, es gibt nur wenige Spiele die gleichauf bzw. besser sind (Persona Ableger / Trails of...). Deswegen auch eine klare 10/10

[h3]Content 09/10:[/h3]

Riesige Welt, jede Menge Orte zu erkunden, jede Menge hidden Places, Choconbo Schatzsuche!, und ein Kartenspiel das leider nicht so gut ist.
Die Welt ist Finaltypisch wieder fantastisch :-). Einzelne GEbiete werden von Zeit zu Zeit freigeschlatet dank Story Progression. Alles was man sieht kann bei einem bestimmten Zeitpunkt auch bereist werden.
Chocobo Schatzsuche ist eine tolle Erfindung, denn dadurch wird die Welt noch intensiver bereist und der Spieler hat eine größere Zusammengehörigkeit mit der Welt. 
Auch Choco unsere Chocobo hat eine Geschichte zu erzählen die in keinem anderen FF vorhanden ist, Chapeau Squaresoft tolle Idee tolle Umsetzung.
Ich bemerkte wie ich mehrere Stunden mit dem Chocobo verbracht habe und mir das recht gut gefallen hat.
Das Kartenspiel ist leider zu komlex und nicht so leicht verständlich. 60 Stunden habe ich gespielt bvevor die Credits kamen. Ist sicherlich noch 5 bis 10 Stunden an Material vorhanden.

[h3]Zusammenfassung 09/10:[/h3]

Dieses Final Fantasy schließt mit der PS1 Ära ab und holly molly was für ein Teil. 
Ich war nervös/aufgeregt/rührselig/traurig/wütend/fröhlich diese Gefühlszustände hatte ich und das ist für Final Fantasy ein "Normalprogramm" und ist selbstverständlich.
Das können nicht alle Spieleserien, Final Fantasy und die PS1 Trilogie schafft es mühelos.
Die Protagonisten sind alle sehr gut geschrieben einzig und allein aschwächelt gerade der Hauptrotagonist.

[b]Uneingeschränktes Epos, und für den Preis ein Preis Leistungs Monster!
Mit Mods einfach wunderschön und Zeitlos!
Holts euch dieses FF welche alle Tugenden der klassischen Final Fantasys beinhaltet.[/b]

185941153.review: Best FF game of all time!

185939447.review:
Final Fantasy IX: A Masterpiece of RPG 

Final Fantasy IX is a true gem in the world of role-playing games. With its captivating story, memorable characters, and stunning visuals, it stands out as one of the best entries in the Final Fantasy series. The game's narrative is rich and engaging, taking players on an epic journey through the enchanting world of Gaia. The characters are well-developed and relatable, each with their own unique personalities and backstories that add depth to the overall experience.

The gameplay is a perfect blend of traditional turn-based combat and innovative features. The graphics are a feast for the eyes, with beautifully detailed environments and character designs that bring the world of Gaia to life. The music, composed by the legendary Nobuo Uematsu, is nothing short of a masterpiece, perfectly complementing the game's emotional moments and epic battles.

Final Fantasy IX is a must-play for any RPG fan, offering a timeless experience that continues to captivate players even years after its release. It's a testament to the creativity and dedication of its developers, and a shining example of what makes the Final Fantasy series so beloved.

(This is of course is my opinion).

185774939.review:
O jogo tem menos CGI que os antecessores, e você ainda pode pular as cenas, o que torna mais ágil a jogabilidade.
O jogo mantém comandos tradicionais, além de apresentar ou renovar conceitos antigos dos RPGs como separar os personagens por categorias por exemplo: Mago Negro para ataques e Mago e Branco para cura e suporte. Os menus  são bem intuitivos e os tutoriais didáticos.
A área de habilidades e atributos de personagens é bem simples de entender, tornando mais agradável a jogabilidade
A história é direta e como falei no início, as cenas em CGI podem ser puladas para agilizar o tempo. Assim você pode finalizar o jogo com o maior porcentagem em menos tempo.

185688487.review:
El juego que mas veces termine en mi vida. Si no fuera por el hecho de que el 7 le gana en Originalidad, seria el mejor de los de squareSOFT por escandalo.

Puntos fuertes:
-Volver a 4 personajes le quedo barbaro
-Banda sonora, a mi parecer la mejor de toda la generacion (palo a palo con chrono cross)
-Historia. No te voy a decir nada, jugalo.
-El minijuego del chocobo me resulto bastante entretenido
-Cartas, mas simple que el triple triad (ff8), pero muy entretenido igual
-Desarrollo de cada personaje exquisito
-Envejecio barbaro, el aspecto caricaturesco de los personajes en 3d es espectacular.
-El combate esta un poco mas pulido que en el 7 y 8, pero en lineas generales es mas de lo mismo

Puntos flojos:
-La p*t@ excalibur 2, nunca la puedo conseguir "legalmente"
-Dentro de la historia hay un par de baches o cosas que quedan sin responder, yo las he notado en mi 5 o sexta vez que pase el juego
-Si bien hay 8 personajes para jugar con roles claros, una vez que tienes a tu formacion, nada te motiva a cambiarlos, quedando 4 personajes ciertamente relegados.
-Algo facil a mi parecer comparado con anteriores. Incluso Ozma no le ata los cordones al Arma omega del 8
o Esmeralda y rubi del 7
-El Villano Es una mezcla de Sephirot en lo estetico, con Kefka en lo actitudinal ,ciertamente teatral por momentos. Es una mezcla buena, pero se queda corta a mi parecer frente a esos dos villanos.
-El minijuego de la soga, si buscas platinar, este es el punto de quiebre (yo lo he practicado por años y lo he conseguido 24 años mas tarde desde la primera vez que jugue, no asi la exc 2)

En fin, es mi juego favorito, pero no hay que negar algunos detalles. 9,4 puntos

185463375.review:
As is typical, the original is a classic, while the port is mediocre. Textures don't always look good, and the character models could be much better. Needs widescreen support.

But, much more importantly, this publisher has stated intent to harass and cause financial harm to Steam users & other customers. Proof of their intent is here (you can also google for Square Enix "group harassment policy" to find their January 10th blog post about it):

https://www.hd.square-enix.com/eng/news/2025/html/post_317.html

You can report this toxic company to Steam by doing the following:

- Click on the "Square Enix" link to the right of "Publisher" at the top of the store page.
- Click the gear icon on the top-right. 
- Select "Report this company" and fill in the reason why (I suggest requesting Steam to halt business dealings with them).
- Click "Submit".

You can also choose to "Ignore" all their products from the same gear icon, which I also strongly suggest doing. Send a message to the gaming industry that this disgraceful behavior will not stand, nor go unpunished.

185449765.review:
Final Fantasy IX é, sem dúvida, uma obra-prima dos RPGs japoneses. Seja você um fã de longa data da série ou alguém que nunca jogou um JRPG, este título tem algo especial a oferecer.

Os personagens são cativantes, especialmente o quarteto principal: Zidane, Garnet, Steiner e Vivi. Este último, inclusive, é considerado por muitos, incluindo eu, como um dos melhores personagens de toda a franquia Final Fantasy. Sua profundidade emocional e a forma como sua história se desenvolve são verdadeiramente memoráveis.

O combate, embora simples, possui um charme único. É acessível para novatos, mas ainda tem elementos que agradam os mais experientes. As mecânicas de habilidade, equipáveis através de armas e acessórios, adicionam uma camada de estratégia que enriquece a experiência.

A história é envolvente e vai te prender por horas. Embora alguns considerem o ritmo do final um pouco arrastado, isso nunca me incomodou. Prepare-se para momentos emocionantes e reflexões profundas sobre temas como identidade, morte e propósito.

Os gráficos de Final Fantasy IX são simplesmente incríveis, mesmo nos dias atuais. A direção de arte é atemporal, com cenários pré-renderizados ricos em detalhes e uma estética encantadora que captura perfeitamente o espírito de um conto de fantasia.

No entanto, o remaster oficial feito pela Square Enix foi decepcionante, evidenciando um trabalho apressado e preguiçoso. Texturas de baixa qualidade e modelos mal ajustados não fazem jus à obra original. Por isso, recomendo fortemente o Moguri Mod, uma modificação feita por fãs que eleva o jogo a um novo patamar.

A trilha sonora, composta pelo lendário Nobuo Uematsu, é impecável. Não há uma faixa sequer que não seja memorável. Cada música complementa perfeitamente os momentos do jogo, tornando-se parte inseparável da experiência e, certamente, ficará gravada na sua memória por muito tempo.

Final Fantasy IX foi meu primeiro jogo da franquia que joguei e também o meu primeiro JRPG. Mesmo com o meu inglês limitado na época, a história e os personagens conseguiram me tocar profundamente. Este jogo marcou minha vida de uma forma inesquecível e, para mim, é uma experiência perfeita.

Nota: 11/10. Um clássico atemporal que merece ser jogado por todos os amantes de videogames.

185399559.review: IX is the most underrated Final Fantasy in the series. This port is a great representation of an amazing classic. If your a fan of JRPG and you haven't played this do your self a favor it's worth it

185398343.review: Incredible and timeless game. The story, the music, the gameplay and replayability are just some of the reasons to play FFIX. 10/10.

185383714.review:
FFIX is one of those games that [i]stays with you.[/i] While many people swear by FFVII, for me, this is the perfect closure to the classic Final Fantasy era. The mix of semi-medieval fantasy with steampunk elements and a skill system based on the original FF jobs is pure magic.

The story is incredibly well-crafted. Each character has their own journey that ties perfectly into the bigger picture. And even though the archetypes are recognizable, they feel fresh and deep in their own way.

[h2]The Great[/h2]
[list]
[*]The blend of medieval fantasy and steampunk in the world.
[*]The skill system, based on the original FF jobs system adds a strategic layer.
[*]The story is solid, with characters who grow and feel integral to the whole.
[*]The soundtrack... words can't describe, it's precious.
[/list]

[h2]The Not so Great[/h2]
[list]
[*]Turn-based combat might feel a bit slow for those coming from more fast-paced RPGs.
[*]If you're new to RPGs, the structure might be a bit jarring at first.
[/list]

FF9 is the perfect tribute to the classics. It has everything fans of the genre look for: a solid story, lovable characters, and timeless gameplay.

185048245.review:
FF9 was the only classic FF I hadn't touched for many many years. I just played it for the first time recently, after replaying VI-VIII and X, and I think I finally understand why some people say this is their favorite. While the game is overall a masterpiece, personally, I think it comes down to one simple reason: if you're a completionist and you want to see everything this game has to offer, it's actually NOT torture. It actually respects your time, doesn't grind the pacing to a halt, and is fun at best and harmless at worst.

FF9's side content never overstays its welcome, it's rarely a blink-and-you'll-miss-it affair, it's never tedious (aside from finding Chocographs; even frog catching isn't that bad if you know what you're doing) and it never asks you to grind the story to a halt in order to do them, which helps the pacing of the story a TON. I didn't hate any of it. The Chocobo stuff is a hell of a lot more engaging than the stuff you do with them in other games, and most of the rest of them are fairly harmless button-mashing or QTE affairs. Even if you're going for 100%, the game is still constantly moving. Best of all, Tetra Master is entirely optional and affects nothing outside of one moment in the story.  In other games, if you want to go for the ultimate weapons, or do all the sidequests, the absolute mind-numbingly tedious ♥♥♥♥ you have to do is so insane you'll eventually just say "screw it" and break out a save editor. Not here.

The pacing is really well-done. Random battles are still a thing, but they're actually fairly rare in this game unless you're specifically trying to grind. Dungeons all feel unique and well-designed, they never drag, and they're just really wel-designed. The visuals are just, my god, so good. Some might think fantasy settings and airships were played out even in 2000, but IX perfects that aesthetic. I don't think a single RPG bursts at the seams with charm like this game does. The music is probably the best soundtrack Uematsu has ever done outside of VI, and I have a hard time deciding which one is better.

I also love the mechanics of the game itself. Junctioning and constantly swapping out materia, or god forbid, dealing with the sphere grid in X, gets very tedious very fast. But swapping out a few pieces of equipment or abilities takes literal seconds and you're back to exploring. There's a great balance between flexibility and simplicity, where it's easy to understand and engaging to deal with, and yet the difficulty being cranked up means it never feels too easy (holy crap items actually matter now!). The method of acquiring Blue Magic may seem annoying to some people compared to VIII, but it's a hell of a lot better than it was in VI and VII. It isn't as broken this time, either.

As for the story, regardless of what anyone thinks of the plot itself, IX blows every other entry out of the water when it comes to character writing. I was reminded while playing that VII and VIII have much better theming and settings than they do actual writing, which at times (especially in VIII) just kinda sucks. IX tips the scales all the way in the other direction, and it becomes better for it. The chemistry between the cast is top-notch to the point where the story going off-the-rails and having ridiculous contrived twists and stakes practically doesn't matter because the characters are all so well-written and so likable, it makes you forget about it. (Except Amarant...but tbh he's no worse than Vincent).

The only two major issues with the game are the emphasis on stealing (which can be tedious and annoying) and the battle speed being so slow. There's no real way around the former without cheating to give yourself a 100% success rate (which honestly would still be an improvement IMO), but the latter is easily fixed by cranking up the battle speed in Memoria (you ARE playing with mods, right, weirdo?) and turning the intro skip on.

185033118.review:
Greetings, it’s zushi here. Time for me to talk about final fantasy 9. I just finished it so my thoughts are still fresh.


Story:10/10(The story is quite frankly of one of the best I’ve witnessed in a game in a long time. Playing this game and seeing the story evolve from a medieval fantasy setting to what what it turns into in the climax and ending is stunning. While playing and witnessing the plot twist in certain parts myself I realized how powerful 9’s story was to not just the franchise but to others. It’s clear that some rpg’s years later took inspiration from 9 and that’s a beautiful thing.)


Setting:10/10(The world is magical fantasy and also takes place in a medieval setting which I loved to see. But the game wasn’t just one note and done, going to other towns weren’t just different but still old cities. 9 sprinkled in variety like for example, Lindblum. While it definitely still has the medieval feel, it also is so futuristic at the same time and that was astounding.)


Art:8/10(this might be the lowest scoring yet but it will be the only one this low. The world design itself is amazing but the character design, while I turned to love and welcome, I did not like at first. It was too different and the cgi cutscenes actually made me physically ill the first time I saw them so it was something to get accustomed to. After getting a chance to get used to all, I really loved it but I know I can’t get rid of the first impression.)


Music:9.5/10(I actually listened to the soundtrack months before playing the game and I liked it but felt with my experience with other Final Fantasy’s that this one didn’t have as good as something like 6,7 or 8’s soundtrack.Man was I wrong once I played it and that’s okay. The soundtrack fits this game perfectly and after playing the game, the soundtrack alone is so good that I think it as good as the previously mentioned 6,7 and 8.)


Characters:9.5/10(I have too much to say but I can’t put it into words/text so I’ll be brief: the cast compliments the story,the setting,each other graciously. I only disliked Steiner but he still fits the story perfectly. Yes there is also the mysterious case of Amarant and all I can say is he’s fine. I didn’t grow attached nor disliked him and if you take him away you wouldn’t notice but literally everyone else, even side characters, pretty close to perfect.)


Battle/fights:9.5/10(Standard turn based with the ATB but they added trance which was like a cool transformation for everyone when their emotions are heightened. Boss fights were fun(except ozma….i dont know why I was determined to fight that thing but I did. It look cool though). This game is great. This game shows others what it means to be nigh perfection.)


Overall:9.75/10 PLAY THIS PEAK GAME NOW!

184900021.review: One of my favorite games. I am so excited to play it again

184891612.review:
Final Fantasy IX es, sin duda, una obra maestra que marcó mi infancia de manera profunda. Lo jugué por primera vez cuando tenía solo 6 años en la PS1, y desde ese momento quedó grabado en mi corazón como uno de los mejores juegos que he experimentado. Ahora que he tenido la oportunidad de revivir esa magia en Steam, puedo decir con toda seguridad que sigue siendo tan increíble como lo recordaba, e incluso más.

La historia de Final Fantasy IX es única, llena de emociones, giros inesperados y mensajes que tocan el alma. Es una aventura que logra hacerte reír, reflexionar y, sí, llorar. Hay momentos en este juego que son tan hermosos y significativos que es imposible no sentir una conexión profunda con los personajes y su viaje. Vivi, Zidane, Garnet, Steiner, y todos los demás no son solo personajes de un juego; son compañeros de una travesía que se queda contigo para siempre.

Las escenas son simplemente inolvidables, llenas de detalles que muestran el amor y el esfuerzo que se pusieron en cada rincón de esta obra. Los mensajes sobre la vida, la amistad, el sacrificio y el propósito personal hacen que este juego sea mucho más que un simple RPG. Es una experiencia que te cambia.

Ahora estoy en el proceso de completarlo al 100%, porque este juego se lo merece. Es un homenaje a una época dorada de los videojuegos, un título que envejece con gracia y sigue siendo tan relevante como lo fue en su día. Final Fantasy IX no solo es mi juego favorito de la infancia, sino una obra de arte que permanecerá en mi corazón por siempre. Si aún no lo has jugado, no sabes lo que te estás perdiendo.

184815437.review: It's good but it's trying too hard to be deep sometimes. Pretty enjoyable game tho, not as good as some people are pretending it is because of that and some frustrating combat.

184810557.review:
I'm at a bit of a crossroad for this game. On the one hand, its story and characters alone make the game worth playing. If you're interested in them yourself, definitely give it a shot.

On the other hand, it's gameplay is kinda mixed for me. The ATB battles are good, albeit a bit on the slower side, but that's fine for me. My main gripe of the game is the amount of required mini-games you're forced to go through, as they're plentiful in the main storyline and some of them can get on your nerves (ex: hot and cold). If you like minigames in your JRPGs, you may have a good time, but as someone who wanted to play it for the battles and story, they can get a bit overbearing. 

I also don't recommend going for 100% unless you really want to, as it is extremely demanding due to a specific item that you can only get within the first 12 hours of the game. Trying to get that item alongside trying to do everything else is one of the most daunting things I've seen a game ask out of someone. 

Despite my mixed feelings, I still recommend it if you are interested in it at all. For many, it became their favorite game of all time. For me, my first playthrough was a great time and I'll leave it at that for now.

184795846.review: Voy por la mitad del tercer CD y excepto por algún bug menor el juego es un acercamiento perfecto para alguien que lo juega por primera vez como yo. Las opciones de personalización (desactivar encuentros aleatorios, guardado automático, aumentar velocidad sin que afecte la música como pasaría con un emulador) hacen que se pueda adaptar a cualquier ritmo de juego. Esto me ha permitido centrarme en la historia a mí manera y acercarme al estilo de juego sin presiones (que es lo que quería desde un principio), y lo estoy disfrutarlo enormemente. Eso sin hablar de mods para mejoras gráficas, pero ese ya es otro tema

Final Fantasy IX was my first FF; I played it when I was nine. I've played it a few times since over the years and will probably play it again one day. Love the gameplay, the music, the story, and the battle/ability system.

Small note about the 2016 PC port here on Steam: sometimes (it only happened to me twice in my entire playthrough) the music might get stuck after a battle and keep playing even after the world map or whatever other track is playing. So it'll play two tracks at once, which sounds like total chaos. Saving is fine when this happens. The only way I could fix it was to quit the game and restart.

184293091.review:
This game is great for classic Final Fantasy fans. Good characters, story, and music.

Game play speed is a little slow nowadays without mods. For that reason and more, I definitely suggest installing Memoria Final Fantasy IX Engine mod on GitHub. You can upscale the game graphics, increase frame rate to 120 fps, increase game play speed, adjust sound quality, and other tweaks. You can install other mods through Memoria such as Moguri Mod for nicer graphics assets, or other mods like PlayStation button glyphs.

Worth a play-through if you like older turn-based RPG combat with a grand story.

184260572.review: Moguri mod is an absolute must to clean up the backgrounds. Very nostalgic and fun!

184245704.review:
Nostalgie... Mon tout premier FF, j'avais 8 ans en le découvrant (et j'en avais alors bien bavé, ne maîtrisant pas les mécaniques du jeu haha...). Et pourtant, rejoué encore et encore depuis la sortie de ce qui suit :

Avant de parler du jeu lui-même, un ou deux points vraiment importants à connaître:
Après avoir installé le jeu, installez (gratuitement) le mod Mémoria Engine (allez voir sur leur site pour le télécharger) et vous aurez accès à tous les autres mods qu'il propose d'installer d'un seul clic, surtout bien entendu l'incontournable Moguri Mod qui permet une remasterisation complète des graphismes (jeu ET cinématiques), en HD. Le jeu s'approchait déjà des graphismes de la PS2 à l'époque de sa sortie dans les cinématiques, mais là, il n'a jamais été aussi beau! Donc TRES vivement conseillé par rapport au mode "vanilla", installations de chaque mod faciles en un clic depuis le Mémoria launcher, et avec certains on peut même jouer d'autres personnages dont Beate à partir du disque 3, pour laquelle ils ont même incorporé ses propres lignes de dialogues!!

Maintenant que ce point est posé, parlons du jeu lui-même:

Les scénario et lore sont complètement oufs (je n'ai pas d'autres mots).
J'ai tout de même une légère préférence pour la sensation de dépaysement de FF X, mais il faut reconnaître que le IX est nettement plus fourni et complexe en rebondissements, travail des personnages et de leur story propre, avec même des questions philosophiques abordées. Bref: plus profond que le X malgré tout, différent en somme.

Avec les limites de la PS1 à l'époque, on reste sur du muet, les paroles sont à l'écrit dans des bulles mais cela est tourné à son avantage dans ce jeu car ils en profitent pour lui donner un style très théâtral, et ne soyez pas effrayés par ce mot: tout est toujours joué de façon très juste. Certaines scènes sont volontairement cocasses (et donc hilarantes), d'autres tragiques. Ce n'est surjoué que lorsque cela est réellement opportun, le sérieux et l'émotion sont bien au rendez-vous lorsqu'il le faut. Des scènes sont particulièrement touchantes.

Et tout tient debout! Le monde et ce qu'il s'y passe sont parfaitement crédibles, cohérents. La "Brume", les monstres, les chimères, les interactions entre les personnages, leur psychologie et motivations propres, secrètes ou affirmées... Tout a une explication, qui viendra avec le temps de jeu, rien ne semble laissé au hasard. Les mystères sont peu à peu dévoilés, en soulevant continuellement d'autres.
Ainsi malgré l'âge de ce jeu tout reste mine de rien très réaliste, plus on avance plus c'est captivant, avec à mon goût une mention spéciale pour les deux premiers CDs (pour ceux qui ne connaissaient pas à l'époque: le jeu PS1 tenait sur quatre^^) qui m'ont vraiment transportée il y a maintenant 22 ans de ça... et continuent de le faire aujourd'hui (!) .

Nobuo Uematsu, qui a travaillé sur les FF du premier au dixième, fait toujours des bandes son aussi travaillées, avec pour ce numéro volontairement très peu de piano (utilisé seulement pour des scènes bien précises afin de casser avec le reste de l'ambiance et donner plus de relief à l'histoire), et privilégie d'autres instruments, dont un peu de clavecin, absolument parfaits pour coller à cet univers médiéval-fantastique. Je trouve la bande son de FF IX unique.

Pour synthétiser: il s'agit d'une histoire profonde et vraiment singulière. Même après tant de temps à découvrir d'autres scénarios, je ne retrouve ce feeling nul part ailleurs. 

Installez le jeu puis le launcher Mémoria, et enfin depuis celui-ci au moins les deux mods Moguri (jeu et cinématiques). Avec un peu d'ouverture d'esprit je doute que vous soyez déçu-e, le jeu a en fait grâce à ces mods très bien vieilli. 

Vraiment un de mes jeux préférés.

184153944.review: What can I say about this game that wouldn't just be spoiling a good experience. Having played a couple of other Final Fantasy games, this is easily my favorite. I didn't grow up with the franchise and it seems that everyone's first entry is their preferred, but I can't help but argue this one is objectively the best. Firing on all cylinders and telling a great story with characters that are flawed enough to feel like people you've been around. You don't have to love them all, but beyond the greater narrative, understand their motives. I'd say play all the games previous saving this title for last, I hope you'll thank me later. Do not waste as much time as I did on the jumprope though, can be a bit....defeating.

183798608.review: O MELHOR FINAL FANTASY!!!!!!! Sempre foi meu Final Fantasy favorito e ao revisitá-lo confirmei minhas impressões. Os gráficos são muito bonitos e coloridos, com ângulos inventivos e cenários bem distintos que fazem cada cantinho do mundo ter sua identidade. A música é incrível e o tema de batalha é dos melhores da franquia. O sistema de turnos não inventa muito e é eficiente assim. A história tem momentos comoventes e emocionantes e todos os personagens têm sua personalidade de forma que gostamos deles logo. Zidane é um lindo. Joguem!

183671630.review:
Nota 10/10.

Simplesmente maravilhoso, umas das experiências mais marcantes e envolventes que eu pude ter em um jogo. História linda, personagens carismáticos, mensagens profundas, questões sobre sentido da vida, amizade, amor.. Tudo em um ambiente perfeitamente construído com personagens envolventes.

Uma história para chorar, passar raiva, sorrir, ficar com raiva.. Tudo mesclado em uma profundidade imensa. Uma experiência única.

Tinha preconceito até então com RPG's de turno, até eu jogar este game. Se você é como eu e também possuí algum tipo de receio, tente este jogo, com certeza você vai se surpreender com esta história magnífica.

Com toda certeza irei jogar novamente muito mais vezes.
